description: ELECTION OF THE SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES, SAM RAYBURN (D) VERSUS JOSEPH MARTIN (R).
Issue1: Election of the Speaker of the House

description: TO PASS H.R. 437, A BILL MAKING SUPPLEMENTAL NAVAL APPROPRATIONS.
TO RECOMMIT H.R. 2788, A INDEPENDENT OFFICES APPROPRIATION BILL, 1942, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO REDUCE TOTAL APPROPRIATIONS FOR NON-DEFENSE EXPENDITURES AND THE VETERANS BUREAU BY 25 MILLION.
TO PASS H.R. 2788-INDEPENDENT OFFICES APPROPRIATION BILL, 1942.

TO RECOMMIT H.R. 1176, A BILL TO PROMOTE THE DEFENSE OF THE UNITED STATES (LEND-LEASE), WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO LIMIT TO $2 BILLION THE AMOUNT OF CREDIT EXTENDED TO GREAT BRITAIN TO PURCHASE DEFENSE ARTICLES IN THE U.S. AND WOULD REQUIRE COLLATERAL SECURITY WHEREVER AVAILABLE.
TO PASS H.R. 1776, A BILL TO PROMOTE THE DEFENSE OF THE UNITED STATES (LEND-LEASE BILL).
TO PASS H. RES. 90, A RESOLUTION EXTENDING THE AUTHORIZATION OF THE COMMITTEE ON THE AMERICAN ACTIVITIES UNTIL APRIL 1, 1942.
TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON H. RES. 101, RULE FOR THE CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 2665.
TO PASS H. RES. 101, RULE FOR THE CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 2665.  H. RES. 101 IS AN OPEN RULE PROVIDING TWO HOURS OF DEBATE FOR H.R. 2665, AND ALLOWING 1 MOTION TO RECOMMIT.
TO RECOMMIT H.R. 2665, A BILL FOR APPORTIONMENT OF REPRESENTATIVES IN CONGRESS, TO COMMITTEE ON THE CENSUS WITHOUT INSTRUCTIONS.

TO PASS H.R. 2665, A BILL FOR THE APPORTIONMENT OF REPRESENTATIVES IN CONGRESS.  H.R. 2665 LIMITS THE MEMBERSHIP OF THE HOUSE TO 435 MEMBERS, TO BE APPORTIONED AMONG THE STATES EVERY 10 YEARS, ACCORDING TO THE EQUAL- PROPORTIONS METHOD.
TO PASS H. RES. 131, PROVIDING THAT H.R. 1776, WITH SENATE AMENDMENTS THERETO, BE TAKEN FROM THE SPEAKER'S TABLE TO THE END THAT ALL SENATE AMENDMENTS BE AGREED TO.

TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 120 AND THE RESOLUTION, WHICH AUTHORIZES A 9-MEMBER COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE MATTERS RELATING TO THE NATIONAL DEFENSE.  THE AMENDMENT PERMITS THE COMMITTEE TO WITHHOLD FROM PUBLICATION ANY OF ITS DATA WHICH IT DEEMS IN THE PUBLIC INTEREST TO WITHHOLD.

TO RECOMMIT H.R. 4050, DEFENSE AID SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATION BILL, (APPROPRIATIONS FOR LEND-LEASE), WITH INSTRUCTIONS REQUIRING THAT THE APPROPRIATIONS MADE UNDER H.R. 4050 NOT BE USED FOT THE PLACEMENT OF FACILITIES, AQUISITION OF SITES, MANUFACTURE OF DEFENSE ARTICLES, OR COMPENSATION FOR PROCUREMENT OR MANUFACTURE THEREOF OUTSIDE THE BOUNDARIES OF THE U.S. OR CANAL ZONE AND THAT NO FUNDS GIVEN UNDER H.R. 4050 BE MADE AVAILABLE TO FOREIGN GOVERNMENTS WITHOUT REIMBURSEMENT IN PROPERTY, IF AVAILABLE, AS COLLATERAL.
TO PASS H.R. 4050, DEFENSE AID SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATION BILL, 1941, (APPROPRIATION FOR LEND-LEASE).
TO PASS H.R. 4124, FIFTH SUPPLEMENTAL NATIONAL-DEFENSE APPROPRIATION BILL, FOR REMAINDER OF FISCAL 1941.
TO PASS H.R. 3368, A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE OFFICE OF GOVERNMENT REPORTS.
TO PASS S. 262, A BILL TO REGULATE THE WAREHOUSING, STORING, AND RECONCENTRATION OF COTTON HELD BY THE COMMODITY CREDIT CORPORATION.
TO PASS H.R. 968, A BILL TO REGULATE NET WEIGHTS IN INTERSTATE AND FOREIGN COMMERCE TRANSACTION IN COTTON.
TO PASS S.J. RES. 43, AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO ALLOCATE COFFEE QUOTAS TO COUNTRIES NOT INCLUDED IN THE INTER- AMERICAN COFFEE AGREEMENT OF 1940.
TO PASS H. RES. 162, A RESOLUTION INSTRUCTING THE COMMITTEE ON MILITARY AFFAIRS AND THE COMMITTEE ON NAVAL AFFAIRS TO INVESTIGATE THE PROGRESS OF THE NATIONAL DEFENSE PROGRAM.
TO RECOMMIT H.R. 137, A BILL TO PROVIDE FOR ONE ADDITIONAL U.S. DISTRICT JUDGE FOR THE EASTERN DISTRICT OF MO., TO THE COMM. ON THE JUDICIARY WITHOUT INSTRUCTIONS.
TO PASS H.R. 142, PROVIDING THAT U.S. CLERKS, MARSHALLS, AND DISTRICT ATTORNEYS OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA NEED NOT LIVE IN THE DISTRICT.
TO STRIKE THE ENACTING CLAUSE FROM H.R. 4342, A BILL REGULATING BLACK-OUTS IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.

TO RECOMMIT H.R. 4466, A BILL AUTHORIZING THE ACQUISITION OF DOMESTIC AND FOREIGN MERCHANT VESSELS, WITH INSTRUCTIONS PROVIDING THAT FLAGSHIPS OF BELLIGERENT NATIONS TAKEN UNDER THIS ACT SHALL NOT BE TURNED OVER TO ANY BELLIGERENT NATION.
TO PASS H.R. 4466, AUTHORIZING THE ACQUISITION OF DOMESTIC AND FOREIGN MERCHANT VESSELS.
TO PASS H.R. 3490, A BILL TO FIX THE AMOUNT PAID BY THE U.S. TOWARD THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.
TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON S.J. RES. 60, A BILL RELATING TO CORN AND WHEAT MARKETING QUOTAS UNDER THE A.A.A. OF 1938.

TO AMEND H.R. 4671, A BILL TO PROVIDE PLANT-PROTECTION FORCE FOR NAVAL SHORE ESTABLISHMENTS, BY ADDING TO THE BILL THE REQUIREMENT THAT ANY PERSON APPOINTED TO THE FORCE AUTHORIZED THEREIN WHO WAS AN EMPLOYEE OF THE CIVIL-SERVICE WOULD NOT LOSE HIS CIVIL-SERVICE STATUS OR SUFFER ANY REDUCTION IN PAY.

TO PASS H. RES. 211, AN OPEN RULE, PROVIDING 4 HOURS OF DEBATE ON H.R. 4646, A BILL TO EXTEND THE TIME LIMIT WITHIN WHICH THE POWERS RELATING TO THE STABILIZATION FUND AND ALTERATION OF THE DOLLAR MAY BE EXERCISED.
TO RECOMMIT H.R. 4646 WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO ADD TO THE BILL THE REQUIREMENT THAT AFTER THE DATE OF THIS ACT THE U.S. SHALL ACQUIRE NO FOREIGN GOLD AT A PRICE IN EXCESS OF $35. PER OUNCE.
TO PASS H.R. 4646.
TO PASS S. 1438, AN ACT TO EXTEND THE LENDING AUTHORITY OF THE RECONSTRUCTION FINANCE CORPORATION.
TO AGREE TO CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 3368, APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE OFFICE OF GOVERNMENT REPORTS.

TO AMEND H.R. 4965, APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE MILITARY ESTABLISHMENT, 1942, BY PROHIBITING THE USE OF COST-PLUS-A- FIXED-FEE METHOD OF CONTRACTING AS A BASIS FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF FACILITIES AUTHORIZED IN H.R. 4965.
TO PASS H.R. 4965, APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE MILITARY ESTABLISHMENT FOR 1942.
TO PASS S. 158, EXTENDING TO COTTON CROPS THE SAME SYSTEM OF FEDERAL CROP INSURANCE APPLIED TO WHEAT.

TO AMEND H.J. RES. 193, EMERGENCY RELIEF AND WORK RELIEF APPROPRIATION, FISCAL 1942, BY STRIKING A PROVISION REQUIRING THAT A PERSON MAY BE EMPLOYED BY W.P.A. IN CONTINUOUS SERVICE ONLY FOR 18 MONTHS.
TO AMEND H.J. RES. 193, EMERGENCY RELIEF AND WORK RELIEF APPROPRIATIONS, 1942, BY PROHIBITING THE USE OF ANY FUNDS APPROPRIATED IN H.J. RES. 193 FOR THE COMPENSATION OF DAVID LASSER.
TO RECOMMIT H.R. 4590, APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DEPT. OF THE INTERIOR FOR FISCAL 1942, TO THE CONFERENCE COMMITTEE WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO INSIST ON 38 AMENDMENTS IN DISAGREEMENT.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 4590, THAT THE HOUSE RECEDE AND CONCUR WITH THE SENATE IN THEIR DISAGREEMENT WITH SENATE AMENDMENT NO. 33, AUTHORIZING THE SEC. OF THE INTERIOR TO RECEIVE FROM THE SEC. OF WAR PAYMENT FOR MINERAL RIGHTS TO BE ACQUIRED FROM THE OSAGE INDIANS REQUISITE FOR THE HULAH DAM PROJECT AND TO TRANSMIT SUCH FUNDS TO THE OSAGE TRIBAL COUNCIL AS JUST COMPENSATION FOR THE RIGHTS SO ACQUIRED.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 4590, THAT THE HOUSE RECEDE AND CONCUR WITH THE SENATE IN THEIR DISAGREEMENT OVER AMENDMENT NO. 102 AUTHORIZING THE SEC. OF THE INTERIOR TO INCUR CONTRACTUAL OBLIGATIONS FOR 7 RIVER PROJECTS AND APPROPRIATING $7.8 MILLION FOR THIS PURPOSE.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 4693, A BILL MAKING AMENDMENTS TO THE NATIONAL HOUSING ACT, THAT THE HOUSE RECEDE AND CONCUR WITH THE SENATE IN THEIR DISAGREEMENT OVER AMENDMENT NO. 11 WITH AN AMENDMENT.
TO PASS H. RES. 212, A BILL CREATING A COMMITTEE ON THE INVESTIGATION OF PRICES.
TO PASS H. RES. 222, RULE FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 4228, A BILL AMENDING THE U.S. CODE SO AS TO PERMIT WIRETAPPING.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 5049, DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA APPROPRIATION BILL FOR FISCAL 1942.  THAT THE HOUSE RECEDE AND CONCUR WITH THE SENATE IN THEIR DISAGREEMENT OVER AMENDMENT NO. 52, PERMITTING RESIDENTS OF MARYLAND AND VIRGINIA TO ATTEND DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA PUBLIC SCHOOLS WITHOUT A TUITION CHARGE.

TO AMEND H.R. 4228, A BILL AMENDING THE JUDICIAL CODE TO PERMIT WIRE-TAPPING, BY REQUIRING THAT ANY PERSON WISHING TO USE THE POWERS GRANTED UNDER H.R. 4228 MUST APPLY TO A FEDERAL JUDGE FOR PERMISSION TO DO SO RATHER THAN TO THE ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE U.S. AS STATED IN THE ORIGINAL BILL.
TO PASS H.R. 4228, AN AMENDMENT TO THE JUDICIAL CODE TO PERMIT WIRE-TAPPING.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 5166, THE SECOND DEFICIENCY APPROPRIATION BILL FOR FISCAL 1941 AND 1942, THAT THE HOUSE RECEDE AND CONCUR WITH THE SENATE IN THEIR DISAGREEMENT OVER AMENDMENT NO. 28 WITH AN AMENDMENT.  THE HOUSE AMENDMENT APPROPRIATES $1,100,000 TO THE SEC. OF AGRICULTURE TO UNDERTAKE FOREST-FIRE CONTROL MEASURES FOR FISCAL 1942 RATHER THAN FISCAL 1941 AS SPECIFIED IN THE SENATE AMENDMENT.
TO PASS H. RES. 243, RULE FOR CONSIDERATION OF S. 1524, A BILL PROVIDING FOR DEFERMENT OF MEN BY AGE GROUP UNDER THE SELECTIVE SERVICE ACT OF 1940.
TO AMEND S. 1524, BY STRIKING SECTION 2, WHICH COMPELS INDUSTRIES INVOLVED IN NATIONAL DEFENSE TO SUBMIT LABOR DISPUTES TO THE ARBITRATION OF THE CONCILIATION AND MEDIATION BOARDS.

TO AMEND S. 1524, BY STRIKING LANGUAGE WHICH REQUIRES THE PRESIDENT TO SEIZE AND OPERATE ANY PLANT WHERE STRIKES, SUBVERSIVE ELEMENTS OR OTHERWISE HAVE HINDERED PRODUCTION VITAL TO THE NATIONAL DEFENSE AND AUTHORIZES THE PRESIDENT TO PREVENT VIOLENT DEMONSTRATIONS AND TO INSURE THE RIGHT TO WORK OF ANY CITIZEN.
TO PASS S. 1524, LOWERING THE DRAFT-ELIGIBLE AGE FROM 35 TO 28.
TO PASS H. RES. 257, ESTABLISHING A COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE TRANSFER GOVERNMENT AGENCIES FROM THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.
TO STRIKE THE ENACTING CLAUSE FROM S. 1447, A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE MAINTAINENCE OF THE CORPS OF CADETS AT THE U.S. MILITARY ACADEMY AT AUTHORIZED LEVELS.
TO RECOMMIT THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON S. 1524 WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO INSIST FURTHER ON HOUSE AMENDMENTS.
TO PASS H. RES. 280, RULE FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 5417, THE REVENUE ACT OF 1941.
TO AMEND H.R. 5417, THE REVENUE ACT OF 1941, BY STRIKING A PROVISION REQUIRING THAT A HUSBAND AND WIFE LIVING TOGETHER FILE A JOINT INCOME TAX RETURN.
TO PASS H.R. 5417, REVENUE ACT, 1941.
TO PASS S. 1579, AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES TO REQUISITION SUCH PROPERTY AS MAY BE REQUIRED FOR THE DEFENSE OF THE UNITED STATES.
TO OVERRIDE VETO OF S. 1580, DEFENSE HIGHWAY ACT.

TO RECOMMIT H.J. RES. 222, AMENDMENT TO THE SELECTIVE TRAINING AND SERVICE ACT, WITH INSTRUCTIONS DIRECTING THE COMMITTEE ON MILITARY AFFAIRS TO REPORT THE BILL FORTHWITH WITH EVERYTHING AFTER THE ENACTING CLAUSE STRUCK.
TO PASS H.J. RES. 222, AMENDMENT TO THE SELECTIVE SERVICE AND TRAINING ACT, EXTENDING THE TERM OF SERVICE IN THE NATIONAL GUARD RESERVE FORCES, AND REGULAR ARMY FOR SUCH TIME AS MAY BE NEEDED.
TO AGREE TO CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 5300, A BILL ESTABLISHING WHEAT-MARKETING QUOTAS.

TO RECOMMIT THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON S. 1579, A BILL FOR REQUISITIONING OF PROPERTY FOR THE DEFENSE OF THE UNITED STATES, WITH INSTRUCTIONS DIRECTING THE HOUSE CONFEREES TO INSIST FURTHER ON THE HOUSE AMENDMENTS.
TO PASS H.R. 5788, SECOND SUPPLEMENTAL NATIONAL-DEFENSE APPROPRIATION BILL.
TO RECOMMIT H.J. RES. 237, A RESOLUTION AMENDING THE NEUTRALITY ACT OF 1939, TO THE FOREIGN AFFAIRS COMMITTEE FOR FURTHER HEARINGS.
TO PASS H.J. RES. 237, A RESOLUTION AMENDING THE NEUTRALITY ACT OF 1939, BY PERMITTING THE ARMING OF MERCHANT VESSELS.
TO PASS H.R. 146, SETTING PROCEDURES FOR TRIAL WHEN GOOD BEHAVIOR OF FEDERAL JUDGES (EXCEPT SUPREME COURT) IS QUESTIONED.

TO CONCUR IN SENATE AMENDMENT TO H.J. RES. 237, A RESOLUTION AMENDING THE NEUTRALITY ACT OF 1939.  THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H.J. RES. 237 AUTHORIZES THE ENTRY OF U.S. MERCHANT SHIPS INTO BELLIGERENT PORTS.
TO STRIKE THE ENACTING CLAUSE OF H.R. 3, A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE SUPERVISION AND DETENTION OF ALIENS.
TO PASS H.R. 5990, A BILL ESTABLISHING PRICE CONTROLS.

TO AMEND H.R. 4139, THE "VINSON ANTI-STRIKE BILL", BY REQUESTING THAT IN INDUSTRIES VITAL TO THE NATIONAL DEFENSE, THE PRESENT SYSTEMS OF OPEN AND CLOSED SHOPS SHALL REMAIN IN EFFECT, OUTLAWING JURSDICTIONAL AND SYMPATHY STRIKES AND BOYCOTTS, PROHIBITING VIOLENCE DURING STRIKES, INSURING SECRET BALLOT IN STRIKE ELECTIONS, AND REQUIRING REGISTRATION AND ACCOUNTING OF FUNDS OF ALL LABOR UNIONS.
TO PASS H.R. 4139, THE VINSON ANTI-STRIKE BILL, AS AMENDED. (SEE ROLL CALL 1126)
TO RECOMMIT H.R. 6159, NATIONAL DEFENSE SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATION BILL, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO STRIKE ALL OF SECTION II.
TO PASS H.R. 6159, NATIONAL DEFENSE SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATION BILL.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.J. RES. 254, DECLARING THAT A STATE OF WAR FORMALLY EXISTS BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE IMPERIAL GOVERNMENT OF JAPAN.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.J. RES. 256, DECLARING THAT A STATE OF WAR EXISTS BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE GOVERNMENT OF GERMANY.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS S.J. RES. 120, DECLARING THAT A STATE OF WAR EXISTS BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE GOVERNMENT OF ITALY.

TO AMEND H.R. 6109, A BILL AMENDING THE NEUTRALITY ACT OF 1940, BY LIMITING TO PERSONS BORN WITHIN THE U.S. OR ITS POSSESSIONS THE REQUIREMENTS OF H.R. 6109 THAT U.S. CITIZENS CLAIMING DUAL CITIZANSHIP AND U.S. CITIZENS CLAIMED AS CITIZENS BY A FOREIGN GOVERNMENT MUST TAKE AN OATH OF ALLEGIANCE TO THE U.S. AND RENOUNCE CLAIMS OF LOYALTY TO ANY OTHER COUNTRY.

TO AMEND H.R. 5727, THE CIVILIAN DEFENSE BILL, BY ELIMINATING FROM THE OFFICE OF CIVILIAN DEFENSE THE POSITION OF DIRECTOR OF CIVILIAN DEFENSE AND VESTING AUTHORITY OF THAT POSITION IN THE SECRETARY OF WAR.
TO AMEND H.R. 5727, BY ESTABLISHING THE POSITION OF ASST. SEC. OF WAR TO ADMINISTER THE CIVILIAN DEFENSE PROGRAM.
TO CONSIDER H.R. 4643, A BILL TO REGULATE SMALL-LOAN BUSINESSES IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.
TO PASS H.R. 4643, A BILL TO REGULATE SMALL-LOAN BUSINESSES IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.
TO PASS H.R. 10, TO REINSTATE IN THE COURT OF CLAIMS TWO SUITS BY THE CHEROKEE INDIANS AGAINST THE U.S.
TO RECOMMIT CONFERENCE REPORT ON S. 1936 WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO INSIST ON HOUSE AMENDMENTS TRANSFERRING THE POSITION OF DIRECTOR OF CIVILIAN DEFENSE TO THE OFFICE OF WAR.
TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON S. 1936.
TO PASS H.R. 6448, FOURTH SUPPLEMENTAL NATIONAL DEFENSE APPROPRIATION BILL.

TO RECOMMIT CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 5990, A BILL SETTING PRICE CONTROLS, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO STRIKE THE AUTHORIZATION FOR THE O.P.A. TO ISSUE AND REVOKE LICENSES AND REINSTATE A PROVISION FOR A BOARD OF REVIEW.
TO AGREE TO CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 5990 IN A BILL SETTING PRICE CONTROL.
TO PASS H.R. 6460, NAVAL APPROPRIATION BILL, 1943.
TO RECOMMIT H.R. 6359, A BILL FOR THE RELIEF FOR CERTAIN AGRICULTURAL PRODUCERS IN STRIKEN AREAS.
TO AMEND H.R. 6548, THE FIRST DEFICIENCY APPROPRIATION BILL, REDUCING SUNDRY APPROPRIATIONS AND FORBIDDING THE USE OF ANY FUNDS APPROPRIATED IN THE BILL FOR THE PRODUCTION OF MOTION PICTURES.
TO PASS H.R. 6483, APPROPRIATING FUNDS FOR HOUSING IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.
TO PASS H.R. 6611, THE FIFTH SUPPLEMENTAL NATIONAL DEFENSE APPROPRIATION BILL.

TO PASS H.R. 5638, A BILL AMENDING EMPLOYMENT STABILIZATION ACT OF 1931., BY ADDING A SECTION AUTHORIZING THE APPROPRIATION OF FUNDS TO BE USED BY THE PRESIDENT FOR MAKING STUDIES FOR EXPEDITING PUBLIC WORKS PROGRAMS.

TO INSTRUCT CONFEREES ON H.R. 6446, PAY AND ALLOWANCE OF ARMED FORCES PERSONNEL.  THE INSTRUCTIONS DIRECT THE HOUSE CONFEREES TO AGREE TO THOSE POSITIONS OF THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 644P RELATING TO THE REPEAL OF THAT PART OF THE CIVIL SERVICE RETIREMENT ACT WHICH PROVIDES RETIREMENT PRIVILEGES TO ELECTIVE OFFICERS AND HEADS OF EXECUTIVE DEPARTMENTS.
TO PASS H.R. 6691, INCREASING THE PUBLIC DEBT LIMIT.
TO PASS H. RES. 420, CONTINUING THE AUTHORIZATION AND POWERS OF THE SPECIAL COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE UN-AMERICAN ACTIVITIES.
TO AGREE TO S. 2208, SECOND WAR POWERS BILL.
TO PASS H.R. 6293, ESTABLISHING A WOMEN'S ARMY AUXILIARY CORPS.
TO AMEND H.R. 6802, LEGISLATIVE APPROPRIATION BILL, BY PROHIBITING THE USE OF FUNDS FOR THE PRINTING AND BINDING OF PACT 2 OF THE ANNUAL REPORT OF THE SECRETARY OF AGRICULTURE.
TO AMEND H.R. 5444, A BILL AMENDING THE ACT TO REGULATE HOURS OF BARBERS IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.
TO PASS H.R. 5444, AMENDING THE ACT TO REGULATE HOURS OF BARBERS IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.
TO PASS H.R. 6386, INCREASING SALARIES OF METROPOLITAN POLICE AND OTHERS.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 6736, WAR DEPARTMENT CIVIL FUNCTIONS APPROPRIATION BILL, TO RECEDE AND CONCUR WITH A SENATE AMENDMENT INCREASING BY APPROXIMATELY $24 MILLION THE HOUSE APPROPRIATIONS FOR TABLE ROCK AND BULL SHOALS POWER PROJECTS.
TO TABLE A MOTION TO RE-REFER H.R. 6915, A BILL TO INVEST THE CIRCUIT COURT OF APPEALS WITH ORIGINAL AND EXCLUSIVE JURISDICTION TO REVIEW THE DETENTION OF ALIENS.
TO PASS H. RES. 475, APPROPRIATING FUNDS FOR THE SPECIAL COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE UN-AMERICAN ACTIVITIES.
TO AMEND S. 2025, A BILL REGULATING PAY AND ALLOWANCES OF THE ARMED FORCES, BY RAISING THE MINIMUM MONTHLY PAY OF ENLISTED MEN IN THE ARMED FORCES OF THE U.S. TO $50.
TO PASS S. 2025, A BILL REGULATING PAY AND ALLOWANCES OF THE ARMED FORCES.
TO PASS S. 2505, A BILL TO MOBILIZE THE PRODUCTIVE FACILITIES OF SMALL BUSINESS FOR THE WAR EFFORT.
TO RECOMMIT H.R. 6979, ADDITIONAL CADETS FOR THE MILITARY ACADEMY, TO THE CONFERENCE COMMITTEE FOR FURTHER CONSIDERATION.

TO RECOMMIT S. 2025, A BILL REGULATING PAY AND ALLOWANCES OF MEN IN THE ARMED FORCES, TO THE COMMITTEE OF CONFERENCE WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO INSIST ON THE HOUSE AMENDMENT RAISING THE MONTHLY PAY OF SIXTH GRADE ENLISTED MEN FROM $48. TO $54. AND SEVENTH GRADE ENLISTED MEN FROM $42. TO $50.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 6999 AUTHORIZING CONSTRUCTION OF A BARGE CANAL ACROSS FLORIDA.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.J. RES. 319, DECLARING THAT A STATE OF WAR EXISTS BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE GOVERNMENT OF BULGARIA.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.J. RES. 320 DECLARING THAT A STATE OF WAR EXISTS BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE GOVERNMENT OF HUNGARY.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.J. RES. 321 DECLARING THAT A STATE OF WAR EXISTS BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE GOVERNMENT OF RUMANIA.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 6709, DEPT. OF AGRICULTURE APPROPRIATION BILL, 1943, TO RECEDE AND CONCUR WITH THE SENATE IN THEIR DISAGREEMENT OVER SENATE AMENDMENT NO. 38 WITH AN AMENDMENT ELIMINATING $20,000 FROM THE SENATE APPROVED FUNDS FOR FOREST-FIRE PREVENTION AND FOREST RECREATION FACILITIES.

TO RECOMMIT S. 2025, A BILL REGULATING PAY ALLOWANCES FOR THE ARMED FORCES TO THE COMMITTEE OF CONFERENCE WITH INSTRUCTIONS DIRECTING THE HOUSE CONFEREES TO STRIKE THE PROVISION FOR PAY INCREASES TO OFFICERS RETIRED BY DECISION OF A CLASS B BOARD AND TO REINSTATE A HOUSE AMENDMENT MAKING THE PROVISIONS OF S. 2055 TEMPORARY.
TO AGREE TO CONFERENCE REPORT ON S. 2025, A BILL REGULATING PAY ALLOWANCES FOR THE ARMED FORCES.

TO AMEND H.J. RES. 324, WORK RELIEF AND RELIEF APPROPRIATIONS FOR FISCAL 1943 BY FORBIDING THE USE OF ANY FUNDS APPROPRIATED IN H.J. RES. 324 FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OR UNDERTAKING OF ANY PROJECT NOT ALREADY IN PROGRESS EXCEPT THOSE DETERMINED TO BE NECESSARY TO THE WAR EFFORT.
TO RECOMMIT H.J. RES. 324 WITH INSTRUCTIONS LIMITING APPROPRIATIONS TO $225 MILLION AND REQUIRING STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS TO ADMINISTER RELIEF PROGRAMS AND TO SHARE THE EXPENSES THEREOF.
TO PASS H.J. RES. 324.
TO AMEND H.R. 5349, THE OMNIBUS CLAIMS BILL, BY STRIKING ALL OF TITLE I PROVIDING FOR THE RELIEF OF GEORGE S. WOLBERT.
TO AMEND H.R. 5349, THE OMNIBUS CLAIMS BILL, BY STRIKING TITLE VIII PROVIDING FOR THE RELIEF OF THE WIDOW AND CHILDREN OF DR. JO M. FERGUSON.
TO RECOMMIT H. RES. 490, PIPE LINE AND BARGE CHANNEL ACROSS FLORIDA WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO STRIKE THE AUTHORIZATION FOR A BARGE CANAL ACROSS FLORIDA.
TO PASS H.R. 7184, AUTHORIZING FUNDS AND PROGRAMS FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF NAVAL VESSELS DESIGNED TO INCREASE THE SIZE OF THE NAVY BY 2,000,000 TONS.

TO PASS H. RES. 433, AUTHORIZING THE HOUSE COMMITTEE ON IMMIGRATION AND NATURALIZATION TO UNDERTAKE STUDIES, HOLD HEARINGS, AND REPORT TO CONGRESS CONCERNING PROBLEMS OF ALIENS IN THE U.S. SUCH AS DEPORTATION OF UNDESIRABLE TYPES AND THE PRESENCE OF ENEMY ALIENS.
TO PASS H.R. 7280, THE MILITARY ESTABLISHMENT APPROPRIATION BILL.
TO AGREE TO CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 6845, INTERIOR DEPARTMENT APPROPRIATION BILL.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 6709, DEPT. OF AGRICULTURE APPROPRIATION BILL, TO FURTHER INSIST ON THE HOUSE DISAGREEMENT WITH THE SENATE AMENDMENT NO. 81, WHICH INCLUDES WITHIN THE FARMER'S MARKET PRICE FOR HIS PRODUCT, USED TO DETERMINE HIS TITLE TO PARITY BENEFITS, THE AMOUNT OF SOIL-CONSERVATION BENEFITS EARNED BY HIM IN THE SOIL-CONSERVATION AND DOMESTIC ALLOTMENT PROGRAM.

TO FURTHER INSIST ON THE HOUSE DISAGREEMENT WITH SENATE AMENDMENT NO. 83 TO H.R. 6709.  THE AMENDMENT ALLOWS THE SALE OF GRAIN BELOW PARITY IF THE GRAIN HAS DETERIORATED OR IF IT IS TO BE SOLD FOR FEED OR THE MANUFACTURE OF ALCOHOL. THE HOUSE LANGUAGE REQUIRES BOTH OF THE ABOVE CONDITIONS BEFORE GRAIN MAY BE SOLD BELOW PARITY.
THAT THE HOUSE RECEDE AND CONCUR IN SENATE AMENDMENTS 90 AND 91 TO H.R. 6709, WITH AMENDMENTS.  THE PROPOSED AMENDMENT REDUCES THE FUNDS APPROPRIATED BY SENATE AMENDMENTS 90 AND 91.
TO RECEDE FROM DISAGREEMENT TO SENATE AMENDMENTS 95 AND 96 TO H.R. 6709 AND CONCUR THEREIN WITH AMENDMENTS.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 6845, INTERIOR DEPARTMENT APPROPRIATION BILL, TO RECEDE AND CONCUR WITH SENATE AMENDMENT 156, APPROPRIATING FUNDS FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF TRANSMISSION LINES AT KESWICK POWER PLANT, AN APPROPRIATION WHICH THE HOUSE HAD DISALLOWED.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 7181, DEPARTMENT OF LABOR APPROPRIATION BILL, TO RECEDE AND CONCUR WITH SENATE AMENDMENT NUMBER 9, RESTORING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE CIVILIAN CONSERVATION CORPS.

TO AMEND H.R. 7349, A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE, BY PROVIDING FOR THE SALE OF GOVERNMENT CONTROLLED STOCKS OF FARM COMMODITIES AT LESS THAN PARITY EXCEPT FOR DETERIORATED GRAIN USED FOR FEED AND THE MANUFACTURE OF ALCOHOL, AND EXCEPT FOR PRODUCTS USED FOR RELIEF PURPOSES, SEED PURPOSES AND FOR COTTON REQUIRED BY THE NEW USES PROGRAM OF THE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 6709 TO RECEDE AND CONCUR WITH SENATE AMENDMENT 85 WITH AMENDMENT.  SENATE AMENDMENT 85 PERMITS THE SALE OF 125 MILLION BUSHELS OF WHEAT AT PARITY PRICE FOR PURPOSES OF FEEDING ONLY.  THE HOUSE AMENDMENT WOULD ALLOW SUCH SALE FOR ANY PURPOSE.
TO PASS H.R. 7239, AUTHORIZING THE DIRECTOR OF THE CENSUS TO ISSUE CERTIFICATIONS OF BIRTH RECORDS.
TO PASS H.R. 7378, REVENUES ACT OF 1943.

TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON H. RES. 528, RULE FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 7416, VOTING BY MEMBERS OF THE ARMED FORCES.  H. RES. 528 PROVIDES AN OPEN RULE FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 7416, AND PROVIDES FOR 1 MOTION TO RECOMMIT.
TO PASS H. RES. 528, RULE FOR THE CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 7416.
THAT THE HOUSE RESOLVE ITSELF INTO COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE ON THE STATE OF THE UNION TO CONSIDER H.R. 7416.
TO RECOMMIT THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 7416 TO COMMITTEE OF CONFERENCE WITHOUT INSTRUCTIONS.
TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 7416.

TO PASS H.R. 7565, A BILL TO AMEND THE EMERGENCY PRICE CONTROL ACT OF 1942.
